title.rendered: How Often Should I Have My Air Ducts Cleaned?

content.rendered:
Wondering how often you need air ducts cleaning? As suggested by the National Air Duct Cleaners Association, the residential air ducts should be cleaned every 3 to 5 years.

But it depends on where you live, how often you use your HVAC system, and if anyone in your home has asthma or allergies. If you live in a humid part of the country, or you suffer from asthma, it’s recommended to clean the air ducts every 2 to 3 years.

When is a Good Time To Call Air Ducts Cleaner Near Me

The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) suggests that homeowners should get their air ducts cleaned when:

  •       You see a noticeable pool of dust released from the supply registers (when air exits the vents);
  •       You see rodents or insects entering/exiting ductwork or infestation of vermin anywhere in the home;
  •       You suspect the presence of mold in the air ducts.

Take a look inside your air vent register to check any pollutants. If you see blackened debris around the exterior, it means your system has been recycling pollutants over and over again, affecting its performance.

Also, check out your system whenever you replace the air filters. If you see a lot of dust buildup around the filters, it’s time for a professional air ducts cleaning.

Even if you are using the best quality air filters, sooner or later the air ducts are going to collect debris. There will be dust particles that enter the system somehow or escape through the filter. Just because you have a filter doesn’t mean your ducts don’t need any cleaning.

This is particularly true for homeowners who live in an area that is especially dusty/windy, is surrounded by construction, or has high pollution. Your air ducts are going to collect contaminants very quickly and then get clogged up, compromising the indoor air quality in your home.

So clean out your air ducts every 2-3 years and change your filters twice a year. If you have never hired a “air ducts cleaner near me” for professional cleaning and have been consistently active for over 3 years, it is high time you called in the cleaners.

Benefits of Regular Air Ducts Cleaning

There has been evidence that a thorough air duct cleaning can help manage the respiratory issues. If you suffer from allergies, then dander and pollen can be problematic for you. Similarly, if you have asthma, you know your #1 enemy is dust mites.

All these pollutants are microscopic in nature and are usually found in air ducts. The only way to remove substances like pollen, dust, and dirt from the ducts is by thoroughly cleaning the whole system.

Any good “air ducts cleaner near me” worth its salt will use a rotary brush cabling system and a negative air machine to clean your duct system. The rotary brush knocks the debris loose inside the ducts, while and air machine removes it completely.

Trusted and Reliable Clean Air Solutions in Dallas, TX

At United Home Services, our certified and skilled air ducts cleaning specialists are committed to helping families stay safe and healthy. We are following strict safety guidelines to deal with COVID-19 because our main priority is our clients’ safety.

If you think your indoor air quality might not be as clean as it should be, call us at toll-free at 800-399-4248 or fill out our online contact form to reach us!
